newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's Nat'l Rail says may buy AN assets.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's Nat'l Rail says may buy AN assets.

text.p: Australian government-owned interstate freight operator National Rail Corp said on Thursday it was interested in purchasing some of intrastate freight operator Australian National's assets when it was privatised.
"We have an interest ourselves in pursuing some of the businesses that Australian National currently operates," National Rail managing director Vince Graham told reporters.
"We're interested in adding freight volume to our businesses if there is a commercially sensible way of doing that."
The government has announced a scoping study into both freight businesses as part of its plan to sell them in 1997.
Other groups interested in Australian National include infrastructure investor Macquarie Bank Ltd and New Zealand's Tranz Rail.
Graham said Australian National was expected to be privatised by June next year with the National Rail's sale following before the end of the year.
